Not the best of films, it mostly felt rushed and off putting. I would have probably enjoyed it more if they had made it a mystery with how the Pentatonix were pulling stings for Layla and Teddy (without being seen and only then at the end show a rough idea of what they did to make the lovebirds get together) because the way the film was moving back and forth did not make any sense at all and felt really jumbled. I know that my review is quite negative but I would also love to give credit where credit is due, and with that being said there ARE two characters that stood out for me, first the drunk Santa, not much dialogue but his presence was humorous. Secondly the cousin...golly what a jolly character and played well (by Kalen Allen), got me laughing really hard. I could tell for a fact that blood, sweet and tears were put into perfecting the character; lovely charisma.

Meet Me Next Christmas was shockingly good! I went in with no expectations, and it completely won me over. The story was so heartwarming, with just the right mix of romance, humor, and holiday spirit. It’s the kind of movie that makes you believe in the magic of love and Christmas all over again.

The characters were lovable, the chemistry was spot-on, and the pacing was perfect. Every scene felt meaningful, and the way the story unfolded was both touching and satisfying. It’s one of those movies that leaves you with a warm, happy feeling by the end.

If you’re looking for a festive movie that’s full of charm and heartfelt moments, Meet Me Next Christmas is a must-watch. I absolutely loved it and will definitely be adding it to my holiday movie tradition!

Interesting that no one mentions the Ru Paul cameos.  Netflix can’t make a movie without plugging one of their other cringey shows.  I’ve been subjected to a lot of Hallmark Channel this year and this movie is poorly written and overproduced in comparison to their churn of cheaply made nonsense.  The Pentatonix scenes give it a “fan fiction” feel, the only likable character is Teddy, and not one ounce of this is grounded in reality.  The weird tantric sex couple alone is enough to turn this off.

I watched a lot of bad Christmas movies this season but this is not a “good” bad Christmas movie - this is a 1hr 45min cringe fest. I found myself asking questions like, why am I still watching this, HOW did some of the people in this cast agree to do this movie, there’s no way there’s still X amount of time left, is Penatatonix embarrassed by it, and which of my friends have also suffered through that I can text about it.

I never abandoned ship and did watch it all the way through, but I can’t recommend someone else to do the same.

Cute, but clichéd like all the many modern Christmas romcoms. Meet Me Next Christmas follows Layla (Christina Milian) on a bizarre quest through New York City to secure tickets for a sold-out Pentatonix Christmas Eve concert, aiming to reconnect with a man she met at the airport one year prior. The film leans into a predictable narrative that aligns with what you'd expect for an ending. Milian's performance brings charm to the lead role, and her chemistry with co-star Devale Ellis adds a cute spark to the storyline. While the plot is a complete stretch beyond believability, the movie offers some lighthearted humor.

Christmas movie? Absolutely! That means lots of predictability (no 5 stars), AND feel good, silliness, and music. Features several Pentatonix Christmas favorites and a couple new ones for the movie, all of which meet their very high standards. some plot points and cinematography reminded me of the second Sabrina movie, a personal favorite = Another plus.

This is definitely not a Hallmark movie – – see, for example, drag queen performance and humor – – while doing that genre much better, in my book.

We watched "Meet me..." the night after loving Pentatonix do their 2024 live-tour Christmas show, and enjoyed it more because of that. The sellout crowd ranged from children through octogenarians, lots of dancing, and everyone having a blast. The show in the movie definitely got me in the Christmas spirit...

For any curmudgeon posting a slam review, maybe you free up some concert demand for the rest of us. Better yet, meet us for their show next Christmas, and maybe you'll make new friends (or at least we'll get an extra ticket).

P.S: Maybe I finally figured out how Hallelujah could be a Christmas song.

I really enjoyed watching this movie! While I predicted the ending (and you probably will too), it was still fun to watch from beginning to end. Also I love pentatonix so I loved the humorous scenes with them in it. Its probably not a watch every christmas movie but it’s definitely one you should see at least once if you love cheesy christmas rom-coms!!
